medical_history.chief_complaint: Short stature due to a complete SHOX deletion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 15-year-old girl, was admitted at 13.2 years due to nonfamilial short stature. Her height was 142.0 cm (22.2 SDS). She exhibited mild mesomelic shortening of the lower legs and arm span was 136.0 cm (23.5 SDS). Bone age was assessed at 12 years. She has now reached a height of 149.0 cm (22.4 SDS).
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a normal karyotype. No history of Turner syndrome was present.
medical_history.family_history: The parents and two siblings were of normal height; no relevant hereditary conditions reported.
